intro: Ceropegia abayensis, commonly known as the Abay's ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are adapted for specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
